interestingFact: There are currently 195 countries in the world, comprising 193 United Nations member states and 2 observer states.
India is home to the world’s largest film industry, Bollywood.
Canada has more lakes than any other country—over 2 million!
Tokyo’s Shibuya Crossing is the busiest pedestrian crossing in the world.
Brazil shares borders with every South American country except Chile and Ecuador.
Switzerland consumes more chocolate per capita than any other country.
Australia is the only continent without active volcanoes.
Russia spans 11 time zones, making it the most time-zone-diverse country.
New Zealand was the first country to grant women the right to vote in 1893.
South Sudan is the newest country in the world, gaining independence in 2011.
Guatemala officially recognizes 23 native languages alongside Spanish.
